definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Each side will cut its arsenal to below 1,700.
sentences.chinese: 雙方均將其核彈頭數量減少到1，700枚以下。

sentences.english: He grabbed the pack with the FENRIS warheads, and swung it over his shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 他抓起裝着芬里斯核彈頭的揹包，甩上了他的肩膀。

sentences.english: India has successfully launched a long-range intercontinental ballistic missile able to carry a nuclear warhead, officials say.
sentences.chinese: 印度成功發射一枚可以攜帶核彈頭的洲際彈道導彈。

sentences.english: But the United States will not conduct new nuclear testing, and will not develop new nuclear warheads.
sentences.chinese: 但美國將不進行新的核試驗，也不發展新的核彈頭。

sentences.english: Scientists will soon be able to observe the first instants after a nuclear warhead detonates.
sentences.chinese: 科學家不久將能觀察到核彈頭爆炸的第一瞬間。

sentences.english: Burma wants to have rockets and nuclear warheads.
sentences.chinese: 賽登溫說，“緬甸想擁有火箭和核彈頭。

sentences.english: Blue Team was sent in to recover the warheads, but it turned out to be a trap.
sentences.chinese: 藍隊被派出以奪取這些核彈頭，但是這是一個陷阱。

sentences.english: First of all use a black marker or a felt-tipped pen to draw your characters.
sentences.chinese: 首先使用一個黑色標誌或覺得核彈頭筆提請你字符。

sentences.english: Scientists will soon be able to observe the first instants after a nuclear warhead detonates .
sentences.chinese: 家不久將能觀察到核彈頭爆炸的第一瞬間。

sentences.english: the intelligence apparently helped their scientists build a miniaturized nuclear warhead.
sentences.chinese: 情報人員顯然地幫助了他們的科學家發展小型核彈頭。

sentences.english: But China is modernizing the means to deliver its nuclear warheads.
sentences.chinese: 但中國發射核彈頭的技術和裝備正日趨現代化。

sentences.english: Without the detonator codes, those older nukes were no more dangerous than paperweights.
sentences.chinese: 沒有起爆編碼，這些老式的核彈頭還不如鎮紙危險。

sentences.english: The missile is a single-stage, liquid-propellant design carrying a single nuclear warhead.
sentences.chinese: 導彈是單級，液體推進設計能攜帶一枚單一的核彈頭。

sentences.english: Pakistan successfully test-fired a long-range ballistic missile capable of carrying a nuclear warhead.
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦成功試射了一個可以攜帶核彈頭的遠程導彈。

pinyin: guo2 ji4 dian4 xin4 lian2 meng2

definition: to monitor/to keep an eye on
to evacuate (e.g. foreign civilians from a war zone)
